> +async function refreshDiscordToken(token: Record<string, unknown>): Promise<Record<string, unknown>> {
+  const params = new URLSearchParams({
+    client_id: process.env.DISCORD_CLIENT_ID ?? "",
+    client_secret: process.env.DISCORD_CLIENT_SECRET ?? "",
+    grant_type: "refresh_token",
+    refresh_token: token.refreshToken as string,
+  });
+
+  const response = await fetch("https://discord.com/api/v10/oauth2/token", {
+    method: "POST",
+    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" },
+    body: params.toString(),
+  });
+
+  if (!response.ok) {
+    console.error(

ðŸ”µ **Nitpick: Use structured logging**

Similar to the discord.ts file, consider using a structured logger or at minimum suppressing console output in production environments.

--
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
https://github.com/BillChirico/bills-bot/pull/60#pullrequestreview-3806266861

INSTRUCTIONS: Evaluate this email. If important (login codes, billing, payments, action required, replies to Bill, package tracking), DM Bill using: message action=send channel=discord target=user:191633014441115648 message="brief summary". If not important (marketing, newsletters, spam, test emails from himself, Google security alerts about new sign-ins/devices), reply NO_REPLY. SKIP all Google Security Alert emails. Auto-track any package tracking numbers with 17TRACK.
<<<END_EXTERNAL_UNTRUSTED_CONTENT>>>

Current time: Sunday, February 15th, 2026 â€” 9:02 PM (America/New_York)

Return your summary as plain text; it will be delivered automatically. If the task explicitly calls for messaging a specific external recipient, note who/where it should go instead of sending it yourself.

This is a GitHub notification about a code review comment on PR #60. The comment is a nitpick about using structured logging instead of console output.

**Assessment:** Not important. This is an automated notification about a code review suggestionâ€”no action required, no urgent matter, and not a reply from a person requiring Bill's attention.
